title: National Neighborhood Data Archive (NaNDA): Socioeconomic Status and Demographic Characteristics of Census Tracts and ZIP Code Tabulation Areas, United States, 2000-2020
description: These datasets contain measures of socioeconomic and demographic characteristics by US census tract for the years 2000-2020 and ZIP code tabulation area (ZCTA) for the years 2008-2020. Example measures include population density; population distribution by race, ethnicity, age, and income; income inequality by race and ethnicity; and proportion of population living below the poverty level, receiving public assistance, and female-headed or single parent families with kids. The datasets also contain a set of theoretically derived measures capturing neighborhood socioeconomic disadvantage and affluence, as well as a neighborhood index of Hispanic, foreign born, and limited English.
creator: Philippa Clarke
Grace Noppert
Robert Melendez
Megan Chenoweth
Lindsay Gypin
publisher: University of Michigan. Institute for Social Research
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
subject: Demographics
Economic Stability
Employment
Social and Community Context
methods_variables: high levels of poverty, unemployment, female-headed families, households receiving public assistance income, college education; with incomes>75K, ethnic and immigrant concentration, race, ethnicity, age, income level, employment, poverty, home ownership, Longitudinal,
data_variables: aland20, totpop20, popden16_20, phispanic16_20, pnhwhite16_20, pnhblack16_20, pfborn16_20, plimeng16_20, ped1_16_20,
affluence16_20 mean of ped3_16_20, pfamincge125k16_20, and pprof16_20
disadvantage16_20 mean of pfaminclt40k16_20, ppov16_20, and ppubas16_20
data_usage_notes:
These datasets were created to measure the socioeconomic and demographic characteristics by US census tract for the years 2000-2020 and ZIP code tabulation area (ZCTA) for the years 2008-2020.

Users should be aware that ZCTAs are not equivalent to ZIP codes. ZIP codes are linear
mail delivery routes created by the US Postal Service. ZIP code tabulation areas are
spatial features consisting of census blocks grouped by the predominant ZIP code found
on the block (United States Census Bureau, 2020).
